author: Walsh Amite
comment: In it's simple way, it's fine. No outline style subcategory levels here  -  it allows plain one level list making, re-ordering items is possible by checking as 'done' then unchecking to move to base of list. I'd appreciate a less long-winded way to re-order items. But good, it neatly allots each list its own tab as new lists are made. I'll try a few competitors before I revisit this critique. My main sniff is that this does what a paper list can do, but re-ordering would take it  a bit further.
title: Simple, good as what it does

author: Julie King
comment: Great little app. Just what I was looking for when doing the shopping. Haven't had a chance to check out the reminder. Can't see how that would work though cause there's no option to add location. Without that though, a top app nevertheless
title: Fantastic!

author: Shawn Albrecht
comment: It froze up my text messages bad.  Every time I opened up an app it forced a game app from Google play and took over my phone.  Had to delete the app.
title: Loved it at first but...

author: Mckay Moline
comment: I like it. I agree with other reviewers about adding a tap-and-drag function for sorting. Also would like to see ability to make each list a different color. Is there a button to purge all completed tasks?
title: Simple

author: Mary Mendenhall
comment: It's  simple and clean, but reordering is inefficient.   You have to check it complete and it reorders to bottom;then you can uncheck the item. Awkward.  It would be nice to be able to reorder with a simple number system which would avoid having to move items.  Colors and look of the product is nice.

author: Anikó Orsányi
comment: If I were in bad mood, I would give this 4 because of the bugging. But I'm not. (And the app is great.) It's really minimalistic, the colours are pretty, you can edit items and titles without maneuvering.
title: I have rated it because it kept bugging me to rate it

author: Joe DeRose
comment: I needed a list app for my Android Wear watch, and this one does what I need. I love the simplicity in design. A few tweaks would get 5 stars from me:  (1) I need a setting to let me choose whether the list is sorted alphabetically or by (the current default) most-recently-changed. If I maintain this as a grocery list, then as the list gets longer it will be harder to find things in the checked-off section and put them back in the unchecked section.  (2) I need longer persistence on the Android Wear device. As it is, the list vanishes quickly, and I have to reload it repeatedly as I make my way through a store -- greatly diminishing its convenience and utility.  (3) Separate colors for individual lists (rather than a single color for all of them) would help me distinguish lists at a glance more easily.  Thanks for the work you've done so far.
title: Nice

comment: Never seen an app that nags users so much to rate it. Well, I did it. Happy now? Aside from all the nagging, it is devoid of any interesting features at all. Totally forgettable.
title: Nag nag nag

author: Anish Bari
comment: This app is worth and every user must have this app..!! Except one thing..!! There shoud be a setting for adjusting the transperancy of the widget.. bcoz it covers and hides the wallpaper of my screen..!! I guess others agree too...good luck..!!
title: A suggestion..!!

author: Doug Lowry
comment: Exactly what I was looking for. Not just a grocery list, but the ability to make multiple lists of just anything you want

author: Paula Brown
comment: I like it so far. The main thing I wanted was to be able to see my list on my Samsung gear live watch and it does it perfectly. not sure if I can add stuff to my list from my watch, it doesn't look like I can...
title: works well on my watch

author: Christina Swick
comment: Nothing spectacular, a simple notepad app. There are better notepad apps but this one suits my needs...I like the labeling feature... I do a lot of lists... so it works for me
title: Decent

author: Linda Williams
comment: I love this app, especially because it syncs conistently and immediately with my moto 360. I agree with previous reviewer about the annoying  message to rate the app, but positive outweighs negative.
title: Syncs seamlessly with watch

author: Nikola Mirkov
comment: Does what it was intended to do, and it does it really well. One thing I would like to see: when you open a list, it would be nice for the title and items not to be editable - when you press an item, let it chage checked/unchecked mode; long press can float an item and make it sortable/movable. Then the editing mode could be an additional button away.
title: Nice

comment: Gone through a lot of organization apps...but this is the one I'm sticking with...the android wear support just makes it so much better
title: Simple and works great

author: Nha Vo
comment: Love the color and ease of use. but the widget doesn't have a list to click on for different list, instead it lets you scroll which is alot of work to scroll down. No setting. But it's simple to use
title: Nice color

author: Duke Lukem
comment: Really well made app.  Downed it one star because it keeps asking me to rate the app even though I already did.
title: Works on wear too

author: Hayden O'Sullivan
comment: It's a pretty good app. My one problem is that, when I use the app on android wear, I can't uncheck an item. I can check off an item, but not uncheck it.
title: Good, just one issue

author: Moriah MacDonald
comment: p cool, but for a few missing features: the ability to reorder lists (touch and hold, drag and drop), and better color options (being able to select any hex color, including a 'random' option that assigns a random color each time the app is opened, the option to assign a color to a specific list so the app is in that color when that list is open). a simple details interface would be nice, too, to allow additional notes about list entries.

author: Marina Rossi
comment: Ok for making different lists but no sub category or ability to arrange priority . Also the color selection had no bearing as it changes everything. You are not able to make different lists different colors.

author: Ben Griffiths
comment: One of the best looking apps in terms of visual appeal. Simple, doesn't get bogged down by unnecessary waste.
title: How does this not have more downloads?

author: Mat W
comment: Great and helpful app for shopping, etc. I would suggest the option to move each item around to change the order... So when I forget to add an item, I can slot it in the right spot. Also I noticed when I check the top item (on phone) the list scrolls down to the checked items, where as I would rather it stay at the top of the list.

author: Cody Snyder
comment: Only after a few minutes of use I've already decided to uninstall another list app that was not compatible with Android Wear. This app is simple, unintrusive and very useful.
title: Simple and great for Android Wear

author: Lisa Blycker
comment: I know this sounds cliche but this app really is what I've been looking for. It is simple and does exactly what I want in a list app. I highly recommend it!

author: Roberto Mendoza
comment: Excelent app, I really love the simplicity of this tool, totally useful. One thing I would like to be able, is to move the positions of each list, so I can organize them in the priority order y want to see.
title: Simple, Excellent.

author: Dave Beasley
comment: I like this app and it's OK on my moto 360 as well. Would like more control with the order of items and the ability to back up the lists.
title: Very simple but can be improved

author: Daniel Martinez
comment: It is almost perfect, I have lists of things I want to buy and it will be even better if I could put on a price of each thing so I can manage what things I can afford at the moment.
title: Great!

author: Stephanie Carter
comment: Only thing I'd add so far is the option to reorder the things on your lists
title: Simple setup, easy to use

author: Othnielle Aitchedji
comment: It's a very nice and simple app.Conpared to others ive looked at, it is the best. However, it would be great if the user is able change the color of each list. So the colors of different list and normal background differ.
title: Almost there

author: Mark Young
comment: I am very happy to have found a todo list app that does NOT require me sync it with an external server where privacy issues might be a problem.
title: Works great with Android Wear

author: Bill Bruckner
comment: It's simple. It works mostly. My only issue is that it's a little squirrelly on my Android watch.
title: OK

author: Rabia Asgar
comment: Its a cute nice app just what i needed but i guess it needs new feature of making notes colour change as colour changer only changes background. Make a default colour on background and give option to change evey lists colours seperatly like google keep then ill rate it 5 stars! ^^
title: Nice

author: blue mosaic
comment: Would have liked if I could order or prioritize the lists but I appreciate the simplicity and ease of use over the more complicated ones in which entering stuff takes foever
title: Great for simple multiple lists

author: Lauren Kent
comment: Love the multiple lists so I can verify if I have one thing on many lists I can cross it off all
title: Simple and to point!

author: Jose Ditmore
comment: To my surprise. This is the easiest shopping app that I have found.  Simple and to the point. I can compare my shopping list by writing head titles like (ex. Wal-Mart, Smith's and Dollar Tree store) and  make my list and see quickly what I need from a certain store from my shopping lists. Easy to open and use app once installed into your phone. Thanks keep up the Excellent work.

author: Ivett Buna-Beres
comment: It does what it says it will do, but the on screen messages (such as "rate the app" or "are you sure you want to delete this list") don't show the options that usually say yes, no or later.

author: Diana C
comment: Simple and clean. I like it. Would like to have the ability to change the order of items in a list as priorities change. That capability would make it a 5-star app for me.
title: As advertised.

author: Troy Spartan
comment: Good app for notes/lists. Needs a drag and drop function badly.

author: Katie Blanchard
comment: I love it. OCD me makes lists all the time.. and now I don't lose em. Lol

author: Edmundo Correa
comment: This app works very well along with Google gear. I would like to see the ability to move the items into different order. Throughout the day priorities change. It would be nice to be able to move the items on the list to the top or bottom, depending on the priority of the task.
title: Works great!
